channel.title: Selection Structures :: CIS 308 Textbook
channel.description:
C has if-statements and switch statements that work just like those in Jav and C#. Here is a sample if-statement: int age; //initialize age //print either Child, Teenager, or Adult, depending on age if (num < 11) { printf("Child
"); } else if (num < 18) { printf("Teenager
"); } else printf("Adult
"); Here is a sample switch statement. The expression in the switch clause must evaluate to either a character or an integer: char grade; printf("Enter your grade: "); grade = getchar(); getchar(); //read and discard newline character switch (grade) { case 'A': printf("Excellent
"); break; case 'B': printf("Good
"); break; case 'C': printf("Average
"); break; case 'D': printf("Poor
"); break; case 'F': printf("Failing
"); break; default: printf("Invalid grade
"); }
